question_text: Which of the following statements related to the safety of biomedical instruments  are TRUE?
option1: When a person is exposed to an electrical hazard, let-go current is defined as the  maximum current at which the subject can withdraw voluntarily
option2: Microshock is a physiological response resulting from an electrical current  passing through heart
option3: The patient in an intensive care unit is being exposed to the danger of microshock  because of using internal conductive electrodes in the vicinity of the heart
option4: The 50 Hz safe current limit for a microshock is greater than 50 mA
